result.execSummary:
The defendant Zachary R. Harper was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Zachary R. Harper is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Zachary R. Harper was found guilty of Possession of Child Pornography [Modifiers: Repeater], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Zachary R. Harper was found guilty of Felon Possess Firearm [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Counseling shall specifically include:  Sex Offender Treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
*   $2000 assessment for 4 pornographic images.
May not have contact with victim or victims residence w/o approval of agent,  unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not have contact with anyone under age 18, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  DOC to determin contact w/ Immediate family.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  No access to any computers or internet w/o approval of agent.  Sex offender registry for 15 yrs.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney F Zievers.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Mala Boyce interpreter for deft's family members.  Statements by:  Theresa H., Bonnie H. and Gertrude S.  On ct 1 the court imposes a total sentence of 6 years WSP; 3 years initial confinement w/credit for 220 days served; 3 years extended supervision w/conditions; deft is eligible for CIP and SAP; pay $500 assessment for 4 separate images for a total of $2,000; on ct 7 the court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 2 years consecutive to ct  1; submit DNA sample and pay $500 DNA surcharge, bond applied from file 14CF93.
